ENCUMBRANCE-DESCRIPTION: L'Encombrement entré dans chacune des lignes suivantes est:
ENCUMBRANCE-CHOICE1: L'Encombrement de l'ensemble des objets de la ligne (en ignorant la quantité)
ENCUMBRANCE-CHOICE2: L'Encombrement pour chacun des objets de la ligne (total = qté x enc)
HEAD: Tête
ARMOR-MAIL-PENALTY: Wearing (any) Mail Armor (-10 penalty to Stealth)
ARMOR-PLATE-PENALTY: Wearing (any) Plate Armor (-10 penalty to Stealth)
ARMOR-PLATE-LEGS-PENALTY: Wearing Plate Leggings (-10 penalty to Stealth)
ARMOR-OPEN-PENALTY: Porter un casque ouvert (-10 pénalité Perception)
TRIP-EFFECT: Trip: On hit you can spend 2 Adv for Opp Str/Ath test to try make the target Prone.
WARPSTONE-EFFECT: Warpstone: (+0) Cool/Endurance Test, if failed target gains 1 corruption
DYNAMIC-INJURY-DESC-UNARMED: Spit and sweat flies as your head gets snapped back, but there are no other effects.
RATTLING-BLOW-DESC-UNARMED: The blow smashes painfully into your face, causing your eyes to fill with stars. Gain 1 Blinded condition.
EAR-BASH-DESC-UNARMED: The strike glances the side of your head, muting that ear and causing disorientation. Gain 1 deafened condition.
RINGING-STRIKE-DESC-UNARMED: A solid blow to your cranium echoes through your head. Make an Endurance Test (-0) or gain a stunned condition.
BLACK-EYE-DESC-UNARMED: A blow glances your eye. Gain 2 Blinded Conditions.
BRUISED-JAW-DESC-UNARMED: The strike cracks your chin. Make an b>Endurance Test (-10) or gain a Stunned condition and lose a tooth amputation – Easy.
HEAVY-BRUISING-DESC-UNARMED: Your arm takes a nasty hit, and you are at -10 to any actions using it until you can pass an endurance test )-10. Also, drop anything held in that hand.
EYE-POKE-DESC-UNARMED: Something goes into your eye socket. Gain b>2 Blinded Conditions and make an b>Endurance Test (0) or lose the use of your eye for 10-TB hours, Amputation Easy.
FRACTURED-JAW-DESC-UNARMED: The blow fractures your jaw. Gain 1 Stunned Conditions. Suffer a Broken Bone (Minor) injury.
BAD-CUT-DESC-UNARMED: The strike opens a cut on your arm. Gain a bleeding condition
SMASHED-EAR-DESC-UNARMED: A powerful blow hits your ear and severely damages it. Gain 1 bleeding condition and 1 deafened condition that cannot be removed without medical attention
FLASH-KO-DESC-UNARMED: You go out, but only for a second. Gain the Prone condition, a fatigued condition and make an Endurance Test (-10) or gain a Stunned condition
CLEANED-CLOCK-DESC-UNARMED: A solid thump to the skull. Take 1 Deafened, make an endurance test (0) taking 5-sl Stunned Conditions. Gain a Fatigued Condition that lasts for 1d10 days.
TEETH-KNOCKED-DESC-UNARMED: The blow smashes several teeth. Gain 1 bleeding condition and spit out 1d10 teeth – Amputation – Easy
BROKEN-NOSE-DESC-UNARMED: A solid blow to the nose. Gain 2 Bleeding Conditions. Make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or also gain a Stunned Condition.
BROKEN-JAW-DESC-UNARMED: The blow breaks your jaw. Gain 1 Stunned Condition. Make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain an Unconscious Condition. Suffer a Broken Bone (Major) injury.
TEMPLE-STRIKE-DESC-UNARMED: The attack strikes the sweet spot on your temple. Gain 2 stunned conditions. Make an endurance test (-20) or gain unconscious condition. Gain a fatigued condition that lasts 10-TB days
DISFIGURING-BLOW-DESC-UNARMED: The blow smashes your eye and nose. Gain 2 bleeding, 2 blinded and 2 stunned conditions. Make an endurance (0) test or lose one of your eye and nose (equal chance of either) – amputation (hard)
MANGLED-JAW-DESC-UNARMED: The blow shatters your jaw, sending teeth flying. Gain 2 Bleeding and 3 Stunned Conditions. Suffer a Broken Bone (Major) injury and 1d10 teeth — Amputation (Hard).
JOLTED-WRIST-DESC-UNARMED: Drop whatever was held in that hand.
JARRED-ARM-DESC-UNARMED: Drop anything held in that hand, which is useless for 1d10 – Toughness Bonus Rounds (minimum 1). For this time, treat the hand as lost (see Amputated Parts)
SPRAIN-DESC-UNARMED: You sprain your arm, suffering a Torn Muscle (Minor) injury (Suffer a penalty of –10 to all Tests involving the location).
DEAD-ARM-DESC-UNARMED: Your arm is useless for the next 1d10-TB rounds (minimum 1) – count as amputated
STRONG-BLOW-DESC-UNARMED: You are rocked by the blow, take an endurance test (0) or gain a stunned condition
CRUSHED-HAND-DESC-UNARMED: Your hand takes the brunt of the attack. Make an endurance test (+20) and break 5-SLs fingers
TORN-MUSCLES-DESC-UNARMED: The blow slams into your forearm, tearing something inside. Gain a Torn Muscle (Minor) injury.
CRUNCHING-BLOW-DESC-UNARMED: The blow opens a deep, gaping wound. Gain 2 Bleeding Conditions. Until you receive Surgery to stitch up the cut, any associated Arm Damage you receive will also inflict 1 Bleeding Condition as the wound reopens.
WRENCHED-ARM-DESC-UNARMED: Drop any item held in that hand. The arm is useless for 1d10 Rounds (see Amputated Parts).
SEVERE-BRUISING-DESC-UNARMED: Your am is deeply bruised by the blow, causing you to suffer a -10 to any actions using that arm until medical attention is received.
THUNDEROUS-BLOW-DESC-UNARMED: You take the hit on your arm, sending waves of pain and shock through your body. Gain a stunned condition and take an endurance test (-10) or gain a second stunned condition
CLEAN-BREAK-DESC-UNARMED: Drop whatever was held in that hand and gain a Broken Bone (Minor) injury. Pass a Difficult (–10) Endurance Test or gain a Stunned Condition.
BROKEN-FINGERS-DESC-UNARMED: Drop any item held in that hand and gain Broken Bone minor as 1d5 of your fingers are broken.
CRUSHED-ELBOW-DESC-UNARMED: Drop whatever was held in that hand and gain a Broken Bone (Major) injury.
RUPTURED-LIGAMENT-DESC-UNARMED: Drop items held in that hand. Suffer a Torn Muscle (Major) injury.
DISLOCATED-SHOULDER-DESC-UNARMED: The arm counts as lost (see Amputated Part). Gain 1 Stunned Condition until you receive Medical Attention. After initial treatment an Extended Average (+20) Heal Test reaching 6 SL resets the arm. After which tests made using the arm suffer a –10 penalty for 1d10 days.
GLANCING-BLOW-DESC-UNARMED: The strike bounces off but slightly staggers you. Make an athletics (+20) test or gain the prone condition
PAINFUL-HIT-DESC-UNARMED: The hit is more painful than damaging, take -10 to all actions for the rest of this turn and all of the next turn.
FIERCE-BLOW-DESC-UNARMED: You take a strong hit that saps your strength. Suffer a -10 to to strength and agility for 1d10 turns.
BRUISED-DESC-UNARMED: The blows are hard, and leave their marks. Make an endurance test (0) or gain a fatigued condition
GUT-BLOW-DESC-UNARMED: Gain 1 Stunned Condition. Pass an Easy (+40) Endurance Test or vomit, gaining the Prone Condition.
WINDED-DESC-UNARMED: Gain a Stunned Condition. Make an Average (+20) Endurance Test, or gain the Prone Condition. Movement is halved for 1d10 Rounds as you get your breath back.
OFF-BALANCE-DESC-UNARMED: The strike knocks you off balance. Make an athletics test (-10) or gain the prone condition.
LOW-BLOW-DESC-UNARMED: GROINED! Make an endurance test (-20) or gain 2 stunned coniditions
BRUISED-RIBS-DESC-UNARMED: All Agility-based Tests suffer a –10 penalty for 1d10 days.
SWEET-SPOT-DESC-UNARMED: You get hit right in the solar plexus, gain a stunned condition and make an endurance test (-10) or gain prone condition
MY-CHEST-DESC-UNARMED: A cut is opened, gain 1 bleeding condition.
WRENCHED-COLLAR-BONE-DESC-UNARMED: Randomly select one arm. Drop whatever is held in that hand; the arm is useless for 1d10 Rounds (see Amputated Parts).
CRACKED-RIBS-DESC-UNARMED: The hit cracks one or more ribs. Gain a Stunned Condition. Gain a Broken Bone (Minor) injury.
PULLED-BACK-DESC-UNARMED: Your back turns to white pain as you pull a muscle. Suffer a Torn Muscle (Major) injury.
KIDNEY-BLOW-DESC-UNARMED: Gain the disease symptom Nausea until you can either rest or get medical attention (heal at -10 to fix or a remedy).
LIVER-SHOT-DESC-UNARMED: A perfect blow to the liver is bad news. Make an endurance test (0). If you succeed gain 5-SL stunned conditions and prone condition. If you fail gain unconscious condition.
SMASHED-RIB-CAGE-DESC-UNARMED: Gain a Stunned Condition that can only be removed through Medical Attention. Suffer a Broken Bone (Major) injury.
FRACTURED-HIP-DESC-UNARMED: Gain a Stunned Condition. Take a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or also gain the Prone Condition. Suffer a Broken Bone (Minor) injury.
STUBBED-TOE-DESC-UNARMED: Pass an Average (+20) Endurance Test or suffer –10 on Agility Tests until the end of the next turn.
LOST-FOOTING-DESC-UNARMED: Pass a Challenging (+0) Athletics Test or gain the Prone Condition.
TWISTED-ANKLE-DESC-UNARMED: Agility Tests suffer a –10 penalty for 1d10 rounds.
THIGH-STRIKE-DESC-UNARMED: A blow slams into your upper thigh. Take an Endurance Test (-10) or gain the Prone Condition.
TWISTED-KNEE-DESC-UNARMED: You twist your knee too far. Agility Tests suffer a –20 penalty for 1d10 Rounds.
CUT-LEG-DESC-UNARMED: A cut gets opened up  Gain a bleeding Condition.
BUCKLED-DESC-UNARMED: The blow knocks your leg from under you. Take an athletics test (-20) or gain prone condition.
DEEP-BRUISING-DESC-UNARMED: Agility Tests suffer a –10 penalty and half movement for 10-TB days
SWEPT-DESC-UNARMED: You are knocked from your feet. Gain the prone condition and take an endurance test (0) or gain a stunned condition.
CRACKED-KNEE-DESC-UNARMED: Gain a Prone and Stunned Condition. Gain a broken Bone (minor) Injury.
MANGLED-LEG-DESC-UNARMED: Your leg has taken a lot of punishment. Gain a torn muscle (minor) injury and a broken bone (minor) injury.
HARD-KNOCKDOWN-DESC-UNARMED: You get knocked down hard, gain prone condition and 1 stunned condition.
CRUSHED-FOOT-DESC-UNARMED: Make an Average (+20) Endurance Test. if you fail, gain the Prone Condition and lose 1 toe, plus 1 additional toe for each SL below 0 — Amputation (Average). Gain a broken Bone (minor) injury.
BROKEN-KNEE-DESC-UNARMED: You gain 1 Prone, and 1 Stunned Condition, and a Broken Bone (Major) injury.
RUPTURED-TENDON-DESC-UNARMED: Gain a Prone and Stunned Condition. Pass a Hard (–20) Endurance Test or gain the Unconscious Condition. Your leg is useless (see Amputated Parts). Suffer a Torn Muscle (Major) injury.
KO-DESC-UNARMED: You fall into the shadow realm. Gain the unconscious and Prone conditions.
ITS-TOO-MUCH-DESC-UNARMED: The pain is just too much and the victim falls unconscious and prone
OH-HES-HURT-DESC-UNARMED: You collapse in agony as something extra goes in your leg. Gain unconscious condition and roll a standard critical hit to see what other fate befalls you. Add half of the critical hit modifier to this roll.
THIS-LOOKS-SERIOUS-DESC-UNARMED: You are brutally knocked out, suffering extra pain in the process. Gain unconscious condition and roll a standard critical hit to see what other fate befalls you at no modifier
SINGED-DESC-UNARMED: One of the victims items is damaged by the energy.
SCORCHED-DESC-UNARMED: A blast of heat makes the victim suffer -10 to all actions for the rest of this turn and all of the next..
FLASHED-DESC-UNARMED: The victim gains 1 blinded and 1 deafened condtion.
SET-ALIGHT-DESC-UNARMED: Something on the victim bursts into fire. They gain 1 ablaze condition.
MINOR-BURNS-DESC-UNARMED: The victim takes a painful burn, and gains 1 fatigued condition.
PANIC-DESC-UNARMED: The heat, the light, its all too much for the victim. They must make a cool test (0) or suffer a broken condition.
FLASHBANG-DESC-UNARMED: The heat, the light, its all too much for the victim. They must make a cool test (0) or suffer a broken condition.
DISORIENTING-BLAST-DESC-UNARMED: The victim gains 1 stunned condition, and takes an endurance test (-10) or gain a second stunned condition.
BOWLED-OVER-DESC-UNARMED: The victim is knocked Prone by the attack, forced to the knees or blasted over.
BADLY-BURNT-DESC-UNARMED: The victim is badly burnt, and suffers 1 fatigued condition and take an endurance test (0) or suffer 1 stunned condition.
ABLAZE-DESC-UNARMED: The victims belongings catch on fire. They gain 2 ablaze conditions, and 2 of their items are damaged .
SEVERE-TISSUE-DAMAGE-DESC-UNARMED: The energy blast destroys some of the victims flesh. The location struck suffers a torn muscle (major, but an endurance test 0 reduces it to minor).
BURST-BLOOD-VESSELS-DESC-UNARMED: The attack burns and boils the victims flesh, causing 2 bleeding conditions.
CRACKED-BONES-DESC-UNARMED: The power of the effect cracks one of the victims bones. The location struck suffers a Broken Bone (major, but an endurance 0 test reduces it to minor).
SEVERE-BURNS-DESC-UNARMED: The victim is severely burned, and gains 2 fatigued conditions and take an endurance test (-10) or gain 3 stunned conditions.
PARTIAL-DISINTEGRATION-DESC-UNARMED: The location that was struck by the effect is burnt or melted or turned to ash or whatever. The hit location is considered to be amputated. Body hits can be considered to be a Broken Bone (major) and torn Muscle (major). Head hits instead destroy a random facial feature (eyes, ears, nose, mouth). This is considered Very Hard Amputation. Any armour used to deflect this critical hit is completely destroyed unless it is indestructable, as are any objects held or carried in that location.
CONCUSSIVE-SHOCK-DESC-UNARMED: The victim immediately gains 3 stunned conditions and take an endurance (-20) test or gain unconscious.
HORRIBLE-BURNS-DESC-UNARMED: The victim is horribly burned, and will suffer permanent injury and disfigurement as a result. They immediately gain 3 fatigued conditions and take an endurance (-20) test or gain unconscious. If they survive, they permanently reduce ALL characteristics by 2d10 and must make a cool test (0) or suffer from an immediate mental corruption.
ERUPTION-DESC-UNARMED: The victim erupts in a ball of fire, staggering 1d5 yards in a random direction, inflicting an ablaze condition on any creature they move through and setting fire to the environment at GM discretions, before collapsing to the ground dead.
EXPLOSION-DESC-UNARMED: The victim explodes, inflicting a damage 4+1d10 hit on everyone within 3 yards. The victim is of course quite dead.
DISINTEGRATED-DESC-UNARMED: There is a blinding flash and nothing remains of the victim at all. Except, perhaps, for a pair of smoking boots. Any indestructible or magic items survive at GM discretion.
DYNAMIC-INJURY-DESC: Une fine entaille qui va du front jusqu'à la joue. Gagner 1 État Hémorragique. Une fois que la blessure est guérie, l'impressionnante cicatrice qu'elle laisse vous permet d'obtenir un bonus de +1 à certains Tests sociaux.
MINOR-CUT-DESC: Le coup vous entaille la joue et le sang dégouline partout. Gagnez 1 État Hémorragique
POKED-EYE-DESC: Le coup érafle votre orbite. Gagnez 1 État Aveuglé
EAR-BASH-DESC: Your ear takes a sickening impact, leaving it ringing. The Gain 1 Deafened Condition.
RATTLING-BLOW-DESC: Le coup brouille votre vision, vous percever des points blancs et des flashs de lumière. Obtenez 1 État Assommé
BLACK-EYE-DESC: Un coup massif arrive dans votre oeil, provoquant une grande douleur et des larmes. Gagner 2 États Aveuglé.
SLICED-EAR-DESC: Vous prenez ujn coup très violent sur le côté de votre tête, vous entaillant profondément l'oreille. Gagner 2 États Assourdi et 1 État Hémorragique.
STRUCK-FOREHEAD-DESC: Un coup puissant frappe le centre de votre front. Gagnez 2 États Hémorragiques et 1 État Aveuglé qui ne peut pas être retiré tant que tous les États Hémorragiques ne sont pas enlevés.
FRACTURED-JAW-DESC: With a sickening crunch, pain fills your face as the blow fractures your jaw. Gain 2 Stunned contions. Suffer a Broken Bone (Minor) injury (–30 to all Language Tests).
MAJOR-EYE-WOUND-DESC: Le coup passe en travers de votre orbite. Gagnez 1 État Hémorragique. Également gagnez 1 États Aveuglé qui ne pourra être retiré que lorsque on vous appliquera Aide Médicale.
MAJOR-EAR-WOUND-DESC: Le coup endommage votre oreille, provoquant une perte auditive permanente. Subissez une pénalité de -20 à tout Test relatif à l'audition.  Si vous souffrez à nouveau de ce résultat, votre audition est définitivement perdue car la deuxième oreille devient elle aussi sourde. Ne peut être guéri que par la magie.
BROKEN-NOSE-DESC: A solid blow to the centre of your face causing blood to pour. Gain 2 Bleeding Conditions. Make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or also gain a Stunned Condition. After this wound has healed, gain +1/–1SL on social rolls, depending on context, unless Surgery is used to reset the nose.
BROKEN-JAW-DESC: The crack is sickening as the blow hits you under the chin, breaking your jaw. Gain 3 Stunned Conditions. Make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain an Unconscious Condition. Suffer a Broken Bone (Major) injury (–30 to all Language Tests).
CONCUSSIVE-BLOW-DESC: Your brain rattles in your skull as blood spurts from your nose and ears. Take 1 Deafened , 2 Bleeding , and 1d10 Stunned Conditions. Gain a Fatigued Condition that lasts for 1d10 days. If you receive another Critical Wound to your head while suffering this Fatigued Condition, make an Average (+20) Endurance Test or also gain an Unconscious Condition.
CONCUSSIVE-BLOW-DESC2: A solid thump to the skull. Take 1 Deafened, 2 Bleeding, and 1d10 StunnedConditions. Gain a Fatigued Condition that lasts for 1d10 days.
SMASHED-MOUTH-DESC: With a sickening crunch, your mouth is suddenly filled with broken teeth and blood. Gain 2 Bleeding Conditions. Lose 1d10 teeth — Amputation (Easy).
MANGLED-EAR-DESC: Il ne reste plus grand-chose de votre oreille quand le coup la déchiquette. Vous obtenez 3 États Assourdi et 2 États Hémorragique. Perdez votre oreille - Amputation (moyenne).
DEVASTATED-EYE-DESC: A strike to your eye completely bursts it, causing extraordinary pain. Gain 3 Blinded , 2 Bleeding , and 1 Stunned Condition. Lose your eye — Amputation (Difficult)
DISFIGURING-BLOW-DESC: The blow smashes your entire face, destroying your eye and nose in a cloud of blood. Gain 3 Bleeding , 3 Blinded and 2 Stunned Conditions. Lose your eye and nose — Amputation (Hard).
MANGLED-JAW-DESC: The blow almost removes your jaw as it utterly destroys your tongue, sending teeth flying in a shower of blood. Gain 4 Bleeding and 3 Stunned Conditions. Make a Very Hard (–30) Endurance Test or gain an Unconscious Condition. Suffer a Broken Bone (Major) injury (–30 to all Language Tests) and lose your tongue and 1d10 teeth — Amputation (Hard).
DECAPITATED-DESC: Your head is entirely severed from your neck and soars through the air, landing 1d10 feet away in a random direction (see Scatter). Your body collapses, instantly dead.
JOLTED-WRIST-DESC: Drop whatever was held in that hand.
JARRED-ARM-DESC: Votre bras est secoué lors de l'attaque. Lâchez ce qu'il y avait dans cette main.
JARRED-ARM-DESC2: Drop anything held in that hand, which is useless for 1d10 – Toughness Bonus Rounds (minimum 1). For this time, treat the hand as lost (see Amputated Parts).
MINOR-CUT-ARM-DESC: Gagnez 1 État Hémorragique car vous saignez abondamment au niveau de l'avant-bras.
SPRAIN-DESC: You sprain your arm, suffering a Torn Muscle (Minor) injury (Suffer a penalty of –10 to all Tests involving the location).
BADLY-JARRED-ARM-DESC: Your arm is badly jarred in the attack. Drop whatever was held in that hand, which is useless for 1d10–TB rounds (minimum 1). For this time, treat the hand as lost (see Amputated Part).
TORN-MUSCLES-DESC: The blow slams into your forearm. Gain a Bleeding Condition and a Torn Muscle (Minor) injury (Suffer a penalty of –10 to all Tests involving the location).
BLEEDING-HAND-DESC: Your hand is cut badly, making your grip slippery. Take 1 Bleeding Condition. While suffering from that Bleeding Condition, make an Average (+20) Dexterity Test before taking any Action that requires something being held in that hand; if you fail, the item slips from your grip.
WRENCHED-ARM-DESC: Your arm is almost pulled from its socket. Drop whatever is held in the associate hand; the arm is useless for 1d10 Rounds (see Amputated Parts).
GAPING-WOUND-DESC: The blow opens a deep, gaping wound. Gain 2 Bleeding Conditions. Until you receive Surgery to stitch up the cut, any associated Arm Damage you receive will also inflict 1 Bleeding Condition as the wound reopens.
CLEAN-BREAK-DESC: An audible crack resounds as the blow strikes your arm. Drop whatever was held in the associated hand and gain a Broken Bone (Minor) injury (The Hit Location is unusable until the breakage heals) injury. Pass a Difficult (–10) Endurance Test or gain a Stunned Condition.
RUPTURED-LIGAMENT-DESC: You immediately drop whatever was held in that hand. Suffer a Torn Muscle (Major) injury (Suffer a penalty of –20 to all Tests involving the location).
DEEP-CUT-DESC: Gain 2 Bleeding Conditions as your arm is mangled. Gain 1 Stunned Condition and suffer a Torn Muscle (Minor) injury (Suffer a penalty of –10 to all Tests involving the location). Take a Hard (–20) Endurance Test or gain the Unconscious Condition.
DAMAGED-ARTERY-DESC: Gain 4 Bleeding Conditions. Until you receive Surgery, every time you take Damage to this Arm Hit Location gain 2 Bleeding Conditions.
CRUSHED-ELBOW-DESC: The blow crushes your elbow, splintering bone and cartilage. You immediately drop whatever was held in that hand and gain a Broken Bone (Major) injury (The Hit Location is unusable until the breakage heals).
DISLOCATED-SHOULDER-DESC: Your arm is wrenched out of its socket. Pass a Hard (–20) Endurance Test or gain the Stunned and Prone Condition. Drop whatever is held in that hand: the arm is useless and counts as lost (see Amputated Part). Gain 1 Stunned Condition until you receive Medical Attention. After this initial Medical Attention, an Extended Routine (+20) Heal Test needing 6 SL is required to reset the arm, at which point you regain its use. Tests made using this arm suffer a –10 penalty for 1d10 days.
SEVERED-FINGER-DESC: You gape in horror as a finger flies — Amputation (Average). Gain a Bleeding condition.
CLEFT-HAND-DESC: Your hand splays open from the blow. Lose 1 finger — Amputation (Difficult). Gain 2 Bleeding and 1 Stunned Condition. For every succeeding Round in which you don't receive Medical Attention, you lose another finger as the wound tears; if you run out of fingers, you lose the hand — Amputation (Difficult).
MAULED-BICEP-DESC: The blow almost separates bicep and tendon from bone, leaving an ugly wound that sprays blood over you and your opponent. You automatically drop anything held in the associated hand and suffers a Torn Muscle (Major) injury (Suffer a penalty of –20 to all Tests involving the location) and 2 Bleeding and 1 Stun Condition.
MANGLED-HAND-DESC: Your hand is left a mauled, bleeding mess. You lose your hand — Amputation (Hard). Gain 2 Bleeding Condition. Take a Hard (–20) Endurance Test or gain the Stunned and Prone Conditions.
SLICED-TENDONS-DESC: Your tendons are cut by the blow, leaving your arm hanging useless — Amputation (Very Hard). Gain 3 Bleeding , 1 Prone , and 1 Stunned Condition. Pass a Hard (–20) Endurance Test or gain the Unconscious Condition.
BRUTAL-DISMEMBERMENT-DESC: Your arm is severed, spraying arterial blood 1d10 feet in a random direction (see Scatter), before the blow follows through to your chest.
GUT-BLOW-DESC: Gain 1 Stunned Condition. Pass an Easy (+40) Endurance Test, or vomit, gaining the Prone Condition.
LOW-BLOW-DESC: Make a Hard (-20) Endurance Test or gain 3 Stunned Condition.
TWISTED-BACK-DESC: Suffer a Torn Muscle (Minor) injury (Suffer a penalty of –10 to all Tests involving the location).
WINDED-DESC: Gain the Stunned Condition. Make an Average (+20) Endurance Test, or gain the Prone Condition. Movement is halved for 1d10 rounds as you get your breath back.
BRUISED-RIBS-DESC: Tous les Tests basés sur l'Agilité subissent une pénalité de -10 pendant 1d10 jours.
WRENCHED-COLLAR-BONE-DESC: Randomly select one arm. Drop whatever is held in that hand; the arm is useless for 1d10 rounds (see Amputated Parts).
CRACKED-RIBS-DESC: The hit cracks one or more ribs. Gain the Stunned Condition. Gain a Broken Bone (Minor) injury (Suffer a loss of –30 to your Strength and Agility Characteristics, and half your Movement).
GAPING-WOUND-BODY-DESC: Take 3 Bleeding Conditions. Until you receive Surgery, any Wounds you receive to the Body Hit Location will inflict an additional Bleeding Condition as the cut reopens.
PAINFUL-CUT-DESC: Gain 2 Bleeding Conditions and the Stunned Condition. Take a Hard (–20) Endurance Test or gain the Unconscious Condition as you black out from the pain. Unless you achieve 4+ SL, you also scream out in agony.
ARTERIAL-DAMAGE-DESC: Gain 4 Bleeding Conditions. Until you receive Surgery, every time you receive Damage to the Body Hit Location, gain 2 Bleeding Conditions.
PULLED-BACKW-DESC: Your back turns to white pain as you pull a muscles. Suffer a Torn Muscle (Major) injury (Suffer a penalty of –20 to all Tests involving the location).
FRACTURED-HIP-DESC: Gain the Stunned Condition. Take a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or also gain the Prone Condition. Suffer a Broken Bone (Minor) injury (Suffer a loss of –30 to your Strength and Agility Characteristics, and half your Movement).
MAJOR-CHEST-WOUND-DESC: You take a significant wound to your chest, flensing skin from muscle and sinew. Take 4 Bleeding Conditions. Until you receive Surgery, to stitch the wound together, any Wounds you receive to the Body Hit Location will also inflict 2 Bleeding Conditions as the tears reopen.
GUT-WOUND-DESC: Contract a Festering Wound (see Disease and Infection) and gain 2 Bleeding
SMASHED-RIB-CAGE-DESC: Gain a Stunned Condition that can only be removed through Medical Attention, and suffer a Broken Bone (Major) injury (Suffer a loss of –30 to your Strength and Agility Characteristics, and half your Movement).
BROKEN-COLLAR-BONE-DESC: Gain the Unconscious Condition until you receive Medical Attention, and suffer a Broken Bone (Major) injury (Suffer a loss of –30 to your Strength and Agility Characteristics, and half your Movement).
INTERNAL-BLEEDING-DESC: Gain a Bleeding Condition that can only be removed through Surgery. Contract Blood Rot (see Disease and Infection).
TORN-APART-DESC: Vous êtes littéralement coupé en deux. La moitié supérieure de votre corp atterrit dans une direction aléatoire, et tout personnage situé à moins de 2 mètres est recouverts de sang.
STUBBED-TOE-DESC: In the scuffle, you stub your toe. Pass a Routine (+20) Endurance Test or suffer –10 on Agility Tests until the end of the next turn.
TWISTED-ANKLE-DESC: Vous vous tordez la cheville. Tous vos Tests d'Agilité subissent une pénalité de -10 pour 1d10 tours.
LOST-FOOTING-DESC: In the scuffle you lose your footing. Pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain the Prone Condition.
THIGH-STRIKE-DESC: A painful blow slams into your upper thigh. Gain a Bleeding Condition and take an Average (+20) Endurance Test or stumble, gaining a Prone Condition.
SPRAINED-ANKLE-DESC: You sprain your ankle, giving you a Torn Muscle (Minor) injury (Suffer a penalty of –10 to all Tests involving the location, also halve your Movement).
TWISTED-KNEE-DESC: Vous vous tordez violemment le genou. Vos Tests d'Agilité subissent une pénalité de -20 pour 1d10 rounds.
BADLY-CUT-TOE-DESC: Gain 1 Bleeding Condition. After the encounter, make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test. If you fail, lose 1 toe — Amputation (Average).
BAD-CUT-DESC: Gain 2 Bleeding conditions as a deep wound opens up your shin. Pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain the Prone Condition.
BADLY-TWISTED-KNEE-DESC: You badly twist your knee trying to avoid your opponent. Gain a Torn Muscle (Major) injury (Suffer a penalty of –20 to all Tests involving the location, also halve your Movement).
HACKED-LEG-DESC: A cut bites down into the hip. Gain 2 Bleeding , 1 Prone Condition, and suffer a Broken Bone (Minor) injury (The Hit Location is unusable until the breakage heals, and you cannot use the Dodge skill at all). Further, take a Hard (–20) Endurance Test or also gain a Stunned condition from the pain.
TORN-THIGH-DESC: Gain 3 Bleeding Conditions as the weapon opens up your upper thigh. Pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain the Prone Condition. Until you receive Surgery to stitch up the wound, each time you receive Damage to this Leg, also receive 1 Bleeding Condition.
RUPTURED-TENDON-DESC: Gain the Prone and Stunned Condition as one of your tendons tears badly. Pass a Hard (–20) Endurance Test or gain the Unconscious Condition. Your leg is useless (see Amputated Parts). Suffer a Torn Muscle (Major) injury (Suffer a penalty of –20 to all Tests involving the location, also halve your Movement).
CARVED-SHIN-DESC: The weapon drives clean through your leg by the knee, slicing into bone and through tendons. Gain a Stunned and Prone Condition. Further, suffer a Torn Muscle (Major) injury (Suffer a penalty of –20 to all Tests involving the location, also halve your Movement) and Broken Bone (Minor) injury (The Hit Location is unusable until the breakage heals, and you cannot use the Dodge skill at all).
BROKEN-KNEE-DESC: The blow hacks into your kneecap, shattering it into several pieces. You gain 1 Bleeding , 1 Prone , and Stunned Condition, and a Broken Bone (Major) injury (The Hit Location is unusable until the breakage heals, and you cannot use the Dodge skill at all) as you fall to the ground, clutching your ruined leg.
DISLOCATED-KNEE-DESC: Your knee is wrenched out of its socket. Gain the Prone Condition. Pass a Hard (–20) Endurance Test, or gain the Stunned Condition, which is not removed until you receive Medical Attention. After this initial Medical Attention, an Extended Routine (+20) Heal Test needing 6 SL is required to reset the knee at which point you regain its use. Movement is halved, and Tests made using this leg suffer a –10 penalty for d10 days.
CRUSHED-FOOT-DESC: The blow crushes your foot. Make an Average (+20) Endurance Test; if you fail, gain the Prone condition and lose 1 toe, plus 1 additional toe for each SL below 0 — Amputation (Average). Gain 2 Bleeding Conditions. If you don't receive Surgery within 1d10 days, you will lose the foot entirely.
SEVERED-FOOT-DESC: Your foot is severed at the ankle and lands 1d10 feet away in a random direction — Amputation (Hard) (see Scatter). You gain 3 Bleeding , 2 Stunned , and 1 Prone Condition.
CUT-TENDON-DESC: A major tendon at the back of your leg is cut, causing you to scream out in pain as your leg collapses. Gain 2 Bleeding , 2 Stunned , and 1 Prone Condition and look on in horror as your leg never works again — Amputation (Very Hard).
SHATTERED-PELVIS-DESC: Le coup vous brise le bassin, vous sectionnant une jambe au passage et atteingnant la seconde. Vous mourez instantanément d'un choc traumatique.
FUMBLE-20-DESC: Vous attrapez un partie de votre anatomie lorsque vous réalisez votre attaque - prenez 1 Blessure, en ignorant le bonus de Résistance ou les points d'Armure.
FUMBLE-40-DESC: Votre arme de mélée vibre fortement, ou votre arme de distance fonctionne mal et s'abîme légèrement – votre amre subit 1 Dommage. Au tour suivant, vous agirez en dernier, quel que soit l'ordre d'Initiative, les Talents, ou les règles spéciales de Récupération (voir page 156).
FUMBLE-60-DESC: Votre manoeuvre était mal estimée, vous mettant hors de portée, ou vous perdez la maîtrise d'une arme à distance. Au tour suivant, votre Action subit une pénalité de -10.
FUMBLE-70-DESC: Vous trébuchez maladroitement, et vous avez du mal à vous redresser. Perdez votre prochain mouvement.
FUMBLE-80-DESC: Vous maniez mal votre arme, ou vous faites tomber vos munitions. Vous ratez votre prochaine action
FUMBLE-90-DESC: You overextend yourself or stumble and twist your ankle. Suffer a Torn Muscle (Minor) injury. This counts as a Critical Wound.
FUMBLE-100-DESC: Vous ratez complètement votre attaque, frappant 1 allié au hasard se trouvant à portée, en utilisant votre dé des unité pour déterminer le DR du coup. Si personne n'est à portée, vous vous frappez au visage d'une manière ou d'une autre et opbtenez l'État Assommé (page 169)
FUMBLE2-20-DESC: Ouch: You catch a part of your anatomy, or your opponent lands a glancing strike as you leave a gap in your defenses, or injure yourself on a part of the terrain - lose 1 Wound, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armor Points.
FUMBLE2-40-DESC: Weapon Damage: Your melee weapons jars badly, or your ranged weapon malfunctions - your weapon suffers 1 Damage (this reduces the damage of any attacks made that resulted in a Fumble).
FUMBLE2-60-DESC: Out of Position: A misjudged maneuver leaves you out of position. If in melee, one engaged opponent gains 1 Advantage. If not, you take a -10% to your next Action. This often coincides with a shift in the battlefield: a dirt slope might begin to come loose beneath your feet, or your opponents might force you backwards, perhaps out of engagement with your allies.
FUMBLE2-70-DESC: Movement Fumble: You stumble badly or inadvertently move to a poor position on the battlefield - beneath a giant’s feet, at the edge of a cliff, near a raging fire etc. You must use your Move this round (or next round, if you’ve already used your Move this turn) to try to escape the danger, often with a Test of some kind. If no such dangerous location exists nearby, you simply fall Prone.
FUMBLE2-80-DESC: Action Fumble: You mishandle your weapon or equipment, lose your footing, or otherwise make a mistake that will require your Action to address next turn. Your weapon could become stuck in an enemy’s shield or nearby part of the terrain, or your ammunition could begin to spill from its pouch or quiver, or you strike a nearby stack of crates that topples over on you.
FUMBLE2-90-DESC: Injury: You overextend yourself and are injured, or take a Condition. The environment or other circumstances can provide inspiration for this: If sharp objects are nearby, you might begin Bleeding, or if you’re too close to a fire you could light Ablaze. Depending on the danger of the environment and the -SL of the Fumble, the GM can assign more than 1 Condition. Alternatively, roll for a hit location and the GM chooses one of the less severe Critical Injuries to apply.
FUMBLE2-100-DESC: Dire Consequences: Truly bad things happen. The GM is encouraged to be creative. You might inadvertently strike an ally, using your rolled units die to determine SL. A large creature might pick you up, causing you to become Grappled and take some damage from the crushing grip.. Your weapon could take 1d10 points of Damage or simply break, or fly from your hands into a location that’s difficult to recover.
AMPUTATION-4-DESC: DR -4 ou pire Obtenez l'État Inconscient
OLD-TRAPPINGS: Utiliser l'ancienne mise en page de l'inventaire
NEW-TRAPPINGS: Utiliser la nouvelle mise en page de l'inventaire
HOUSERULE1-INITIATIVE: Règle 1: Test d'Initiative, déterminé par le DR
HOUSERULE3-INITIATIVE: Règle 3: Lancer 1d10 + Bonus d'Agilité + Bonus d'Initiative
MINOR1: Signe de Sorcière: la prochaine créature vivante à naître dans un rayon de 1 kilomètre mute
MINOR2: Lait caillé: tout le lait dans un rayon de 1d100 mètres tourne instantanément.
MINOR3: Mildiou: un nombre de champs égal à votre bonus de Force Mentale dans un rayon de (Bonus de Force Mentale) kilomètres subissent une calamité, et toutes les cultures pourrissent dans la nuit.
MINOR4: Cérumen: vos oreilles se bouchent instantanément à cause d'une cire épaisse. Gagnez 1 État Assourdi, qui ne peut être retiré jusqu'a ce que quelqu'un les nettoie pour vous en utilisant avec succès la Compétence Guérison.
MINOR5: Freezing Breath: The temperature in your immediate vicinity falls suddenly and people’s breath can be seen in the air. People within Willpower Bonus yards of you must make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or suffer –10 Ballistic Skill, Agility, and Dexterity due to the sudden cold until they leave the area. The effect lasts for 1 minute.
MINOR6: Unfasten: On your person, every buckle unfastens, and every lace unties, which may cause belts to fall, pouches to open, bags to fall, and armour to slip.
MINOR7: Warward Garb: your clothes seem to writhe with a mind of their own. Receive 1 Entangled Condition with a Strength of 1d10×5 to resist.
MINOR8: Curse of Temperance: All alcohol within 1d100 yards goes bad, tasting bitter and foul.
MINOR9: Cloying Tongue: All Language Tests (including Casting Tests) suffer a –10 penalty for 1d10 Rounds.
MINOR10: Driven to Distraction: If engaged in combat, gain the Surprised Condition. Otherwise, you are completely startled, your heart racing, and unable to concentrate for a few moments.
MINOR11: Unholy Visions: Fleeting visions of profane and unholy acts harass you. Receive a Blinded Condition; pass a Challenging (+0) Cool Test or gain another.
MINOR12: Hexeyes: Your eyes turn an unnatural colour associated with your Lore for 1d10 hours. While your eyes are discoloured, you have 1 Blinded Condition that cannot be resolved by any means.
MINOR13: Rupture: Your nose, eyes, and ears bleed profusely. Gain a Bleeding Condition.
MINOR14: Fell Whispers: Pass a Routine (+20) Willpower Test or gain 1 Corruption point.
MINOR15: The Horror!: Pass a Hard (–20) Cool Test or gain 1 Broken Condition.
MINOR17: Intestinal Rebelion: Your bowels move uncontrollably and you soil yourself. Gain 1 Fatigued Condition, which cannot be removed until you can change your clothes and clean yourself up.
MINOR18: Marked by Magic: You suffer from an arcane mark, associated with the Wind of Magic you worked. See page 58 for Marks of Hysh, page 70 for Marks of Chamon, page 82 for Marks of Ghyran, page 94 for marks of Azyr, page 106 for Marks of Ulgu, page 118 for Marks of Shyish, page 130 for Marks of Aqshy, and page 142 for Marks of Ghur. If no Arcane Marks Table exists for your magical tradition, roll again on the Major Miscast Table.
MINOR19: Multiplication d'infortune: effectuez deux lancers de déssur cette table, en relançant tous les résultas entre 91-00.
MINOR20: Chaos en cascade: effectuez un nouveau jet sur le Tableau des Incantations Imparfaites Majeures.
MAJOR1: Voix fantomatiques: toutes les personnes dans un rayon de (Force Mentale) mètres entendent de sombres murmures envoûtants émanant du royaume du Chaos. Toutes les créatures douées de conscience doivent réussir un Test de Calme Accessible (+20) ou gagner 1 Point de Corruption.
MAJOR2: Aethyric Shock: You suffer 1d10 wounds, ignoring your Toughness Bonus and Armour Points. Pass an Average (+20) Endurance Test, or also gain a Stunned Condition.
MAJOR3: Death Walker: Your footsteps leave death in their wake. For the next 1d10 hours, any plant life near you withers and dies.
MAJOR4: Double Trouble: The effect of the spell you cast occurs elsewhere within 1d10 miles. At the GM’s discretion, where possible it should have consequences.
MAJOR5: Soulfire: Gain an Ablaze Condition, as you are wreathed in unholy flames with a colour associated with your Lore.
MAJOR6: Speak In Tongues: You gabble unintelligibly for 1d10 rounds. During this time, you cannot communicate verbally, or make any Casting Tests, although you may otherwise act normally.
MAJOR7: Swarmed: You are engaged by a swarm of aethyric Rats, Giant Spiders, Snakes, or similar (GM’s choice). Use the standard profiles for the relevant creature type, adding the Swarm Creature Trait. After 1d10 rounds, if not yet destroyed, the swarm retreats.
MAJOR8: Ragdoll: You are flung 1d10 yards through the air in a random direction, taking 1d10 wounds on landing, ignoring Armour Points, and receiving the Prone Condition.
MAJOR9: Limb Frozen: One limb (randomly determined) is frozen in place for 1d10 hours. The limb is useless, as if it had been Amputated (see page 180).
MAJOR10: Darkling Sight: You lose the benefit of the Second Sight Talent for 1d10 hours. Channelling Tests also suffer a penalty of –20 for the duration.
MAJOR11: Chaotic Foresight: Gain a bonus pool of 1d10 Fortune points (this may take you beyond your natural limit). Every time you spend one of these points, gain 1 Corruption point. Any of these points remaining at the end of the session are lost.
MAJOR12: Levitation: You are borne aloft on the Winds of Magic, floating 1d10 yards above the ground for 1d10 minutes. Other characters may forcibly move you, and you may move using spells, wings or similar, but will continually return to your levitating position if otherwise left alone. Refer to the Falling rules (see page 166) for what happens when Levitation ends.
MAJOR13: Reguritation: You spew uncontrollably, throwing up far more foul-smelling vomitus than your body can possibly contain. Gain the Stunned Condition, which lasts for 1d10 Rounds.
MAJOR14: Chaos Quake: All creatures within 1d100 yards must pass an Average (+20) Athletics Test or gain the Prone Condition.
MAJOR15: Forgetfulness: The spell you are trying to cast is lost to your memory. If you had previously memorised the spell, you no longer recall it and must memorise it again. If casting from a grimoire, the page upon which the spell is written bursts into flames. The spell is lost and, unless appropriate action is taken quickly, the grimoire receives an Ablaze Condition.
MAJOR16: Coeur de traître: les Sombres dieux vous incitent à commettre une horrible perfidie. Si vous attaquez ou trahissez un allié dans toute la mesure de vos capacités, regagnez tous vos Points de Chance. Si vous faites perdre un Point de Chance à un autre Personnage, gagnez +1 Point de Chance.
MAJOR17: Terrible affaiblissement: gagnez 1 Point de Corruption, 1 État A Terre et 1 État Exténué.
MAJOR18: Puanteur infernale: vous sentez vraiment mauvais ! Vous gagnez le Trait de Créature Perturbant (voir Page 341), et probablement l'inimité de toute personne ayant de l'odorat. Cet effet dure 1d10 heures.
MAJOR19: Drain de puissance: vous êtes incapable d'utiliser le Talent vous permettant de lancer des Sorts (en général Magie des Arcanes, bien que cela puisse être Magie du Chaos ou un Talent Similaire), pendant 1d10 minutes.
MAJOR20: Contre-réaction aethyrique: quiconque situé dans un rayon en mètres égal à votre Bonus de Force Mentale - qu'il soit allié ou ennemi - subit 1d10 Points de Blessure qui ignorent le Bonus d'Endurance et les PA, et recoit 1 État A Terre. S'il n'y a aucune cible à portée, la magie n'a nulle part où aller, donc votre tâte explose, vous tuant instantanément.
WRATH1: Visions sacrées: les visions de votre dieu tourmentent vos sens. Effectuez un Test de Résistance Accessible (+20). Sur un échec, gagnez 1 État Assommé. Le MJ détermine ce qu'impliquent les visions.
WRATH2: Pensez à vos actes: tout Test de Prière réussi ne peut pas obtenir plus de +0 DR pour la semaine suivante.
WRATH3: Tenez compte de mes enseignements: vous subissez une pénalité de -10 à votre Compétence Prière pour les 1d10 + (Points de Péchés) prochains rounds.
WRATH4: Prouvez votre dévotion: gagnez l'État A Terre. Cet État ne peut être retiré jusqu'à ce que vous obteniez un succès sur un Test de Prière Accessible (+20).
WRATH5: Vous abusez de ma patience: vous ne pouvez pas effectuer de Tests de Prière pendant 1d10 rounds.
WRATH6: Vous ne comprenez pas ma volonté: vous subissez une pénalité de -10 à toutes les Compétences associées à votre divinité (déterminées par le MJ) pour les 1d10 + (Points de Péché) prochaines heures.
WRATH7: Je trouve inquiétant votre manque de foi:vous ne pouvez pas effectuer de Tests de Prière pendant 1d10 + (Points de Péché) rounds.
WRATH8: Partagez ma douleur: vous subissez 1 + (Points de Péché) Blessures, qui ignorent le Bonus d'Endurance et les PA. Effectuez également un Test de Résistance Accessible (+20). Sur un échec, gagnez 1 État Assommé.
WRATH9: Votre cause est indigne: vos cibles gagnent l'État A Terre. Elles ne pourront plus être l'objet d'aucune Bénédiction ou Miracle de votre divinité, qui échouent automatiquement pendant les 1d10 + (Points de Péché) prochains jours.
WRATH10: Cessez vos babillages: vous ne pouvez pas effectuer de Tests de Prière pendant les 2d10 + (Points de Péché) prochains rounds.
WRATH11: Ressentez ma colère: vous subissez 1d10 + (Points de Péché) Blessures. Effectuez aussi un Test de Résistance Intermédiaire (+0). Sur un échec, vous gagnez 1 État Assommé.
WRATH12: Je ne vous aiderai pas: vous subissez une pénalité de -10 à une Compétence associée à votre divinité (déterminée par le MJ) pour les 1d10 + (Points de Péché) prochains jours.
WRATH13: Blessures Divines: gagnez 1 + (Points de Péché) États Hémorragique.
WRATH14: Frappé de Cécité: gagnez l'État A Terre. Gagnez 1 + (Points de Péché) États Aveuglé, qui peuvent uniquement être retirés en réussissant un Test de Prière Intermédiaire, qui retire 1 + DR État Aveuglé.
WRATH15: Qu'allez-vous sacrifier ?: vous subissez 1d10 + (Points de Péché) Blessures, ignorant le Bonus d'Endurance et les PA. Effectuez aussi une Test de Résistance Complexe (-10). Sur un échec, vous gagnez 1 État Assommé.
WRATH16: Vous avez péché contre moi: votre dieu est extrêmement contrarié et vous oblige à effectuer des Tests de Prière pour votre Action pendant les 1d10 + (Points de Péché) prochains rounds comme pénitence.
WRATH17: Purifier la chair: vous subissez 2d10 + (Points de Péché) Blessures, qui ignorent le Bonus d'Endurance et les PA. Effectuez aussi un test de Résistance Difficile (-20). Sur un échec, vous gagnez 1 État Assommé. Si vous échouez à -4 DR ou moins, gagnez 1 État Inconscient qui dure un minimum de 1d10 rounds.
WRATH18: Interférences démoniaques: les Sombres dieux répondent à votre demande à la place de votre divinité. 1d10 démons inférieurs apparaissent à 2d10 mètres de votre position, et attaquent les cibles les plus proches.
WRATH19: Redoutez ma colère: gagnez 1 + (Points de Péché) État Brisé.
WRATH21: Châtiment: vous total de Points de Blessures est réduit à 0 (si ce n'est pas déjà le cas) puis vous gagnez 1 État Inconscient, qui ne peut pas être retiré jusqu'à ce que vous récupériez au moins 1 Point de Blessure.
WRATH22: Ne prononcez pas mon nom en vain: vous perdez les Talents Béni et Invocation pour les 1d10 + (Points de Péché) prochains jours.
WRATH23: Ne vous attachez pas aux futilités: toutes vos Possessions vous sont ôtées, vous laissant nu. Pour chaque Pénitence achevée, vous récupérez un Objet magique, si vous en aviez.
WRATH24: Vous abusez de ma miséricorde: vous perdez les Talents Béni et Invocation pour les 2d10 + (Points de Péché) prochains jours.
WRATH25: Contemplez votre cruauté: vous subissez des vision insupportables de tous vos échecs; ce qui semble durer une éternité, mais s'arrête en un instant. Discutez avec votre MJ pour déterminer un Trait de Psychologie personnalisé (voir page 190) reflétant la façon dont votre Personnage fait face à cette expérience traumatique.
WRATH26: Tonnerre et Foudre: votre dieu vous foudroie. Vous êtes réduit à 0 Point de Blessure (si vous ne l'êtes pas déjà) et gagnez l'État Enflammé.
WRATH27: Souffrez comme je souffre: vous gagnez 1 + (Points de Péché) États Hémorragiques chaque matin, jusqu'à ce que vous ayez effectué une Pénitence.
WRATH28: Excommunication: vous perdez les Talents Invocation et Béni jusqu'à ce que vous ayez effectué 2 Pénitences : la première restitue le Talent Béni, et la seconde le Talent Invocation. Tous les fidèles de votre dieu sont automatiquement informés de votre état ; tous les Tests pour intérragir avec eux sont automatiquement Très Difficile (-30), et ne peuvent pas être modifiés positivement.
WRATH29: Prouvez votre valeur: un Serviteur de votre divinité apparît à 1d100 mètres et attaque, intervient, réprime ou agit d'une façon similaire selon la nature du dieu offensé.
WRATH30: Je te chasse: votre dieu vous abandonne. vous perdez les Talents Béni et Invocation de façon permanente, et toutes les Améliorations de Prière. De plus, tous les fidèles de votre dieu sont automatiquement informés de votre situation : tous les Tests pour interragir avec eux sont automatiquement Très Difficile (-30), et ne peuvent être modifiés positivement.
WRATH31: Appelé à rendre des comptes: vous êtes convoqué devant votre dieu pour affronter le jugement dernier. A moins que vous n'ayez des Points de Destin, vous ne reviendrez jamais. Si vous dépensez un Point de Destin, vous êtes renvoyé à un moment choisi par le MJ, et vous subissez également les effets de 'Je te chasse' (ci-dessus).
PHYSICAL-MUTATIONC1: Cette mutation ne peut être dissimulée que par des vêtements
PHYSICAL-MUTATIONC2: Un test d'Athlémtisme Difficile (–10) doit être effectué pour avoir une démarche naturelle
PHYSICAL-MUTATIONC3: Cette mutation ne peut pas être dissimulée
PHYSICAL-MUTATION2: Sang Acide: Vous gagnez le trait de Créature Sang Corrosif
PHYSICAL-MUTATION3: Bec: Vous obtenez les traits de Créature Morsure(+1) et Terreur(1)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION4-HEAD1: Ours: +1 point d'Armure à la tête; Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Morsure(+9)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION4-HEAD2: Sanglier: +1 point d'Armure à la tête; Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Cornes (Défenses)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION4-HEAD3: Taureau: +1 point d'Armure à la tête; Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Cornes
PHYSICAL-MUTATION4-HEAD4: Chien: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Morsure(+5)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION4-HEAD5: Aigle: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Morsure(+4)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION4-HEAD6: Rat: Vous obtenez les traits de Créature Morsure(+4) et Infecté
PHYSICAL-MUTATION4-HEAD7: Araignée Géante: Vous obtenez les traits de Créature Morsure(+3) et Venin (moyen)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION4-HEAD8: Chèvre: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Cornes
PHYSICAL-MUTATION4-HEAD9: Loup: +1 point d'Armure à la tête; Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Morsure(+6); Obtenez le talent Sens Accru (Odorat)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION4-HEAD10: Serpent: +1 point d'Armure à la tête; Vous obtenez les traits de Créature Morsure(+3) et Venin (moyen)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION5: Extrémitées Armées: Votre Dextérité est réduite à 0 de manière permanente. Vous ne pouvez plus être désarmé
PHYSICAL-MUTATION6: Grandes Oreilles: Obtenez le talent Sens Accru (Ouïe)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION7: Pieds d'oiseau: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Arboricole
PHYSICAL-MUTATION8: Visage vide: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Terreur(2)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION9: Cracheur de feu: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Souffle (Feu)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION11: Peau brûlante: Les Créatures ou Objets qui vous touchent physiquement doivent passer un test d'Athlétisme ou gagner l'État Enflammé
PHYSICAL-MUTATION12: Carapace: +1 point d'Amure à deux Localisations aléatoires.
PHYSICAL-MUTATION13: Griffes: Vos mains comptent comme des Armes de Créatures de dommage égal à votre BF
PHYSICAL-MUTATION14: Nuage de Mouches: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Perturbant
PHYSICAL-MUTATION16: Crête sur la tête: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Attrayant lorsque vous avez affaire à des Mutants ou des Hommes-bêtes
PHYSICAL-MUTATION17: Cri assourdissant: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Perturbant
PHYSICAL-MUTATION19: Bras Elastiques: Vous pouvez considérer toute arme de mêlée comme ayant une allonge de +2
PHYSICAL-MUTATION21: Oeil du Diable: Vous pouvez lancer le sort Mauvais Oeil (WFRP, page 256) sans avoir à faire de test mais en dépensant un point de Fortune; Vous subisser immédiatement une Invocation Imparfaite Mineure
PHYSICAL-MUTATION23: Bouche supplémentaire: Lancez un dé sur la table des Localisation pour déterminer sa localisation
PHYSICAL-MUTATION24: Oeil traqueur: Vous voyez à travers/autour des obstacles
PHYSICAL-MUTATION25: Tentacule de chair: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Tentacule
PHYSICAL-MUTATION26: Odeur fétide: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Distraction
PHYSICAL-MUTATION27: Fourrure: Vous ne souffrez plus d'une Exposition (WFRP, page 181) aux climats froids; l'effet d'une Exposition aux climats chauds est doublé
PHYSICAL-MUTATION29: Peau brillante: Vous avez la même luminosité qu'une bougie
PHYSICAL-MUTATION30: Sans tête: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Terreur(2) ; une touche à la tête est considérée comme manquée
PHYSICAL-MUTATION31: Sauteur: Vos Déplacements sont réduits de 2, et ne peut pas être plus grand; Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Bondissant
PHYSICAL-MUTATION32: Beauté inhumaine: +10 Sociébilité; vous ne pouvez plus avoir de cicatrices
PHYSICAL-MUTATION33: Iron Skin: +2 Armour Points to all locations, –10 Agility
PHYSICAL-MUTATION34: Lolling Tongue: –10 to all Language Tests when speaking
PHYSICAL-MUTATION35: Long Arms: If you and your opponent have weapons of the same Reach, your weapon counts as longer (WFRP, page 297)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION37: Long Neck: Half of body hits are head hits
PHYSICAL-MUTATION41: Patchy Feathers: Roll on the Hit Location table twice to see where
PHYSICAL-MUTATION42: Tête d'épingle: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Stupide
PHYSICAL-MUTATION43: Tête d'obus: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Stupide; vous ne pouvez plus porter de casque
PHYSICAL-MUTATION44: Visage réarrangé: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Terreur(1); Les personnages assayant de déterminer si vous mentez souffrent d'une pénalité de -20 à l'Intuition
PHYSICAL-MUTATION45: Chair pourrissante: Vous obtenez les traits de Créature Terreur(2) et Infecté
PHYSICAL-MUTATION46: Couleurs mouvantes: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Perturbant
PHYSICAL-MUTATION48: Visage Squelettique: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Terreur(2)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION49: Peau épineuse: Vous ne pouvez plus porter d'armure; +1 point d'Armure à toutes les Localisations; vous obtenez une attaque gratuite (trait de Créature Arme +4) lorsque vous chargez
PHYSICAL-MUTATION50: Mains et Pieds ventouses: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Marcheur sur les murs
PHYSICAL-MUTATION51: Queue: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Attaque de Queue(+3)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION52: Ecailles épineuses: +1 point d'Armure à toutes les Localisations
PHYSICAL-MUTATION53: Trois yeux: Vous obtenez le talent Sens Accru (Vision)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION54: Peau transparente: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Terreur(2)
PHYSICAL-MUTATION56: Cornes irrégulières: +1 point d'Armure à la tête; les cornes comptent comme une Arme de Créature de dommage égal à votre BF
PHYSICAL-MUTATION57: Peau inabituelle: Votre peau à une étrange couleur ou texture: orange, rayée, tachetée , verruqueuse,...
PHYSICAL-MUTATION58: Frénésie du Warp: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Frénésie; lorsque vous entrez en Frénésie, obtenez temporairement une autre mutation physique aléatoire
PHYSICAL-MUTATION59: Pieds palmés: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Amphibie
PHYSICAL-MUTATION60: Pus dégoulinant: Lancez un dé sur la table des Localisation pour déterminer d'où il s'écoule
PHYSICAL-MUTATION62: Ailes: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Vol(60)
MENTAL-MUTATION1: Fuite Aethyrique: Obtenez le Talent Sorcière! ; –5 Sociabilité, –5 Intelligence
MENTAL-MUTATION2: Psychée Animale: Vous obtenez le trait de Créature Bestial pendant 1d10 heures si vous ratez tout test basé sur la Force Mentale
MENTAL-MUTATION4: Phare de corruption: Dès que vous êtes soumis à de la Psychologie (WFRP, page 190), obtenez le trait de Créature Corruption(Mineure); –10 Sociabilité
MENTAL-MUTATION6: Au-delà de la douleur: Obtenez le trait de Créature Sans Douleur; –20 Initiative, –20 Intelligence
MENTAL-MUTATION7: Âme blasphématoire: Obtenez le trait de Créature Haine(Religion); +10 Willpower
MENTAL-MUTATION8: Esprit foudroyé: Obtenez l'immunité au trait de Créature Psychologie pendant 1d10 rounds dès que vous obtenez l'État Brisé, ensuite, prenez 1d10 États Brisé
MENTAL-MUTATION9: Rêves chaotiques: Obtenez l'État Exténué pendant les deux premières heures de chaque jour
MENTAL-MUTATION12: Haine intermittente: Obtenez le trait de Créature Haine(Cible). Jetez un dé sur la table des Obsessons une fois par jour pour déterminer la cible
MENTAL-MUTATION13: Glorieuse corruption: Obtenez 1 État Exténué pour chaque jour durant lequel vous n'obtenez pas de nouveau point de Corruption, ou durant lequel vous n'êtes pas responsable du gain d'un point de Corruption de quesu'un d'autre; Perdez toues les conditions Exténué lorsque l'une ou l'autre condition est respectée
MENTAL-MUTATION14: Pulsions haineuses: Vous êtes sujet à l'Animosité (WFRP, page 190) envers tout ce qui n'est pas de votre espèce
MENTAL-MUTATION16: Talonné par le désespoir: Obtenez le Symptôme Malaise pendant 1d10 jours si vous ratez un test dérivé de la Force Mentale
MENTAL-MUTATION17: Masochiste effréné: Obtenez le trait de Créature Belliqueux; vous ne pouvez pas Fuir (WFRP, page 165) volontairement
MENTAL-MUTATION19: Saleté persistante: Obtenez le Symptôme Nauséeux pour 1d10 jours dès que vous interragissez avec des choses sales
MENTAL-MUTATION20: Esprit solitaire: –10 à tous les tests lorsque vous êtes seul
MENTAL-MUTATION22: Vagabon stupide: –10 Intelligence, et lorsque vous êtes seul : +10 Force Mentale et obtenez le trait de Créature Stupide
MENTAL-MUTATION23: Paranoïa monstrueuse: Obtenez le trait de Créature Craintif; +10 Initiative
MENTAL-MUTATION25: Faim vorace: Obtenez le trait de Créature Affamé
MENTAL-MUTATION26: Moral Fragile: Obtenez l'État Brisé lorsque vous échouez à un test basé sur la Force Mentale
MENTAL-MUTATION27: Mal de l'âme: Obtenez le Symptôme Convulsions pour 1d10 heures lorsque vous ratez un test basé sur la Force Mentale
MENTAL-MUTATION29: Terrible phobie: Obtenez le trait de Créature Effrayé(Cible), faites un jet sur la table des Obsessions pour déterminer la cible
MENTAL-MUTATION30: Chercheur de sentations fortes: +10 Force Mentale, –10 Initiative
MENTAL-MUTATION33: Malice sans fin: –10 à tous les tests effectuée pour ne pas blesser quelqu'un; +10 sur les Tests destinés à blesser
HOUSERULE1-ADVANTAGE: Règle 1: Aucunes limites  --  *Règle par défaut du Livre de base*
HOUSERULE2-ADVANTAGE: Houserule 2: Advantage has an upper limit equal to each character’s Initiative Bonus.
HOUSERULE3-ADVANTAGE: Houserule 3: Cap advantage at a custom limit, such as 2, 4, or more. Use custom field
HOUSERULE4-ADVANTAGE: Houserule 4: Group Advantage mode (Up in Arms), track manually, the advantage field is disabled.
SETTINGS-HOUSERULES: HOUSERULES: GM to advise on Critical, Initiative, Advantage & Condition Tracking Rules, ensure they are set the same on all Character Sheets in the game.
NOTE-ARMOR-ENC: Input the full Enc of each item (-1 is auto), dont add Enc twice for single item (i.e. leather jack arms/body).
NOTE-HIT-LOC: DMG ABS = TB + AP + Robust lvl (+SHIELD AP if using one)
HOUSERULE1-COND-TRACKER: Houserule 1: Minimal Condition Tracking, only Advantage is integratied into rolls
HOUSERULE2-COND-TRACKER: Houserule 2: Full Condition Tracking (Highest Condition, except Ablaze/Bleeding and Fear, is added to roll modifier automatically, multiple conds do not stack.)
HOUSERULE3-CRIT-TABLE: Houserule 3: Up in Arms + Custom Unarmed & Elemental/Magic
HOUSERULE1-TALENTS: Houserule 1: Allow limited Manual Talent override (Charactistic Modifiers/Hardy/Robust/Sturdy/Strong Back)
HOUSERULE2-TALENTS: Houserule 2: WFRP4e Core Book & supplimental Talent Integration (Talent bonuses are either applied directly on sheet or shown in the roll output text)
PURSUIT-1-DESC: 1. Everyone taking part rolls. Then compare the lowest SL of the pursued and the highest SL of the pursuers.
PURSUIT-2-DESC: 2. If the persued win add to distance or if the perusers win subtract from distance.
PURSUIT-3-DESC: 3. If the Distance falls to 0 or less, the pursuers have caught their quarry! Or if the Distance reaches 10+, the pursuers have lost their quarry! But if the Distance is still between 1-9, Roll again!
SPRINT-1-DESC: You use your Action and Move to sprint (
CLIMB-1-DESC: You use your Action and Move to climb (
LEAP-2-DESC: ) in yards, with no additional extra.
LEAP-3-DESC: ) in yards, plus an extra 6 inches with your jump.
UNCOUNSCIOUS-1-DESC: is knocked out, asleep, or otherwise insensible. You can do nothing on your turn and are completely unaware of your surroundings.
FALLING-4-DESC: yards, but suffer no Damage from the fall.
NOTE-NPC-TAB: NOTE: This tab is primarily aimed at simplifing and speeding up simple NPC combat interaction. Too many NPCs (20+) per page will make page very slow.
SPELL-ADVANTAGE-ON: On - Advantage for arcane spell casting is enabled --  *Core Book Default*
SPELL-ADVANTAGE-OFF: Off - Advantage for arcane spell casting is disabled.
FAST-EFFECT: Fast: Defender -10 Roll Mod if not Fast
HACK-EFFECT: Hack: On hit HitLoc Armor Dmg +1
WRAP-EFFECT: Wrap: Defender Opposed test -1 SL Mod
TRAP-BLADE-EFFECT: Or Trap Blade : Opp Str test
DISARM-1-DESC: Disarm: Oppose with Melee & ignore Dmg
DISARM-2-DESC: If Won weapon flies 1d10 ft, GM direction
DISARM-3-DESC: +2 SL choose ft / +4 SL choose direction
DISARM-4-DESC: +6 SL you take it if you have a free hand
DISTRACT-TALENT-DESC1: Distract: Target to Oppose with Cool test
DISTRACT-TALENT-DESC2: If Target loses roll it gains no Advantage until the end of the next Round.
BEAT-BLADE-TALENT-DESC1: Beat Blade: Test is not Opposed
BEAT-BLADE-TALENT-DESC2: If success Target loses 1 Adv, +1 for each +SL. Does not work Vs Large/Unarmed
BEAT-BLADE-TALENT-DESC3: If success Target loses 1 Group Adv, +1 if >5SL. Does not work Vs Large/Unarmed
DRILLED-EFFECT: Drilled: If Roll lost, keep upto
DRILLED-EFFECT3: Drilled: Count as 2 at end of round
FEINT-1-DESC: Feint: Oppose with Melee & ignore Dmg
FEINT-2-DESC: If Won you may add any +SL to your next
FEINT-3-DESC: attack on the same target next turn
SHIELDSMAN-EFFECT2: Spend 2 Adv to push 2 ft or do Dmg
SLAYER-EFFECT: Slayer: Use target TB if > SB
SLAYER-CRIT-EFFECT: Slayer: Times ALL dmg by size diff
INTEGRATION-NO: Player/GM controlled, Talent functions not Integrated
AUTO-AMMO-DESC: Ranged Automatic Ammo Consumption (In chat reroll button does not consume)
RITUAL-CONJURATION-ELEMENTAL-DEATH: Conjuration of the Incarnate Elemental of Death
GRIMMC1: Seared In the Mind: The wizard's head feels like it will explode with pain as they take 1d10 + 1 damage ignoring AP. However the wizard immediatly memorises the spell.
GRIMMC2: All Pain, No Gain: The wizard is racked with pain taking 1d10 + 4 dmg ignoring AP.
GRIMMC4: Up in Smoke: Magical energy burns the spell from the Grimoire and it is lost.
OVERCHANNELING-RULE2: Allow Overchannelling SLs to add +SL to Spell Cast
